location: Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

lines.text: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus, DROMIO of Ephesus, ANGELO, and BALTHAZAR

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Good Signior Angelo, you must excuse us all My wife is shrewish when I keep not hours: Say that I lingerd with you at your shop To see the making of her carcanet, And that tomorrow you will bring it home. But heres a villain that would face me down He met me on the mart, and that I beat him, And charged him with a thousand marks in gold, And that I did deny my wife and house. Thou drunkard, thou, what didst thou mean by this

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Say what you will, sir, but I know what I know That you beat me at the mart, I have your hand to show: If the skin were parchment, and the blows you gave were ink, Your own handwriting would tell you what I think. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: I think thou art an ass.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Marry, so it doth appear By the wrongs I suffer and the blows I bear. I should kick, being kickd and, being at that pass, You would keep from my heels and beware of an ass. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Youre sad, Signior Balthazar: pray God our cheer May answer my good will and your good welcome here.

lines.speaker: balthazar
lines.text: I hold your dainties cheap, sir, and your welcome dear. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: O, Signior Balthazar, either at flesh or fish, A table full of welcome make scarce one dainty dish.

lines.speaker: balthazar
lines.text: Good meat, sir, is common that every churl affords. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: And welcome more common for thats nothing but words.

lines.speaker: balthazar
lines.text: Small cheer and great welcome makes a merry feast. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Ay, to a niggardly host, and more sparing guest: But though my cates be mean, take them in good part Better cheer may you have, but not with better heart. But, soft! my door is lockd. Go bid them let us in.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Maud, Bridget, Marian, Cicel, Gillian, Ginn!

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  Mome, malthorse, capon, coxcomb, idiot, patch! Either get thee from the door, or sit down at the hatch. Dost thou conjure for wenches, that thou callst for such store, When one is one too many Go, get thee from the door.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: What patch is made our porter My master stays in the street.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  Let him walk from whence he came, lest he catch cold ons feet. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Who talks within there ho, open the door!

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  Right, sir Ill tell you when, an you tell me wherefore. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Wherefore for my dinner: I have not dined today.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  Nor today here you must not come again when you may. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: What art thou that keepest me out from the house I owe

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  The porter for this time, sir, and my name is Dromio.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: O villain! thou hast stolen both mine office and my name. The one neer got me credit, the other mickle blame. If thou hadst been Dromio today in my place, Thou wouldst have changed thy face for a name or thy name for an ass.

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  What a coil is there, Dromio who are those at the gate

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Let my master in, Luce.

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  Faith, no he comes too late And so tell your master.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: O Lord, I must laugh! Have at you with a proverbShall I set in my staff

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  Have at you with another thatsWhen can you tell

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  If thy name be calld LuceLuce, thou hast answered him well.

lines.speaker: antipholus
lines.text: Do you hear, you minion youll let us in, I hope OF EPHESUS

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  I thought to have asked you.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  And you said no.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: So, come, help: well struck! there was blow for blow. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Thou baggage, let me in.

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  Can you tell for whose sake

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Master, knock the door hard.

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  Let him knock till it ache. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Youll cry for this, minion, if I beat the door down.

lines.speaker: luce
lines.text: [Within]  What needs all that, and a pair of stocks in the town

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: [Within]  Who is that at the door that keeps all this noise

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  By my troth, your town is troubled with unruly boys. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Are you there, wife you might have come before.

lines.speaker: adriana
lines.text: [Within]  Your wife, sir knave! go get you from the door.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: If you went in pain, master, this knave would go sore.

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: Here is neither cheer, sir, nor welcome: we would fain have either.

lines.speaker: balthazar
lines.text: In debating which was best, we shall part with neither.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: They stand at the door, master bid them welcome hither. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: There is something in the wind, that we cannot get in.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: You would say so, master, if your garments were thin. Your cake there is warm within you stand here in the cold: It would make a man mad as a buck, to be so bought and sold. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Go fetch me something: Ill break ope the gate.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  Break any breaking here, and Ill break your knaves pate.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: A man may break a word with you, sir, and words are but wind, Ay, and break it in your face, so he break it not behind.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  It seems thou wantst breaking: out upon thee, hind!

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: Heres too much out upon thee! I pray thee, let me in.

lines.speaker: dromio of syracuse
lines.text: [Within]  Ay, when fowls have no feathers and fish have no fin. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Well, Ill break in: go borrow me a crow.

lines.speaker: dromio of ephesus
lines.text: A crow without feather Master, mean you so For a fish without a fin, theres a fowl without a feather If a crow help us in, sirrah, well pluck a crow together. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Go get thee gone fetch me an iron crow.

lines.speaker: balthazar
lines.text: Have patience, sir O, let it not be so! Herein you war against your reputation And draw within the compass of suspect The unviolated honour of your wife. Once this,your long experience of her wisdom, Her sober virtue, years and modesty, Plead on her part some cause to you unknown: And doubt not, sir, but she will well excuse Why at this time the doors are made against you. Be ruled by me: depart in patience, And let us to the Tiger all to dinner, And about evening come yourself alone To know the reason of this strange restraint. If by strong hand you offer to break in Now in the stirring passage of the day, A vulgar comment will be made of it, And that supposed by the common rout Against your yet ungalled estimation That may with foul intrusion enter in And dwell upon your grave when you are dead For slander lives upon succession, For ever housed where it gets possession. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: You have prevailed: I will depart in quiet, And, in despite of mirth, mean to be merry. I know a wench of excellent discourse, Pretty and witty wild, and yet, too, gentle: There will we dine. This woman that I mean, My wifebut, I protest, without desert Hath oftentimes upbraided me withal: To her will we to dinner. Get you home And fetch the chain by this I know tis made: Bring it, I pray you, to the Porpentine For theres the house: that chain will I bestow Be it for nothing but to spite my wife Upon mine hostess there: good sir, make haste. Since mine own doors refuse to entertain me, Ill knock elsewhere, to see if theyll disdain me.
To Angelo

lines.speaker: angelo
lines.text: Ill meet you at that place some hour hence. ANTIPHOLUS

lines.speaker: of ephesus
lines.text: Do so. This jest shall cost me some expense.
Exeunt
